newsitem.title: USA: U.S. HEADLINE STOCKS - Issues to watch - May 29.
newsitem.headline: U.S. HEADLINE STOCKS - Issues to watch - May 29.

text.p: -- Novell Inc, hurt by declining sales of its computer network software, reported an unexpected loss for the latest quarter and said it plans to cut 1,000 workers in coming months. Novell lost $0.04 a share in the fiscal second quarter, compared to a loss of $0.15 a year earlier.

-- Nike Inc said it expects fiscal fourth quarter earnings of $0.51 to $0.56 a share, with earnings hurt by a one-time $0.04 a share charge related to the shutdown of a manufacturing facility. The First Call consensus estimate is $0.69 a share. The company cited a revenue shortfall due to shifts in its order mix.
-- Opposition is building to a proposed settlement being hammered out in talks between state attorneys general and the tobacco industry, the Wall Street Journal reported.

-- Scholastic Corp said it plans to refocus on its core business. The company forecast it would about break even for the year ending May 31. The First Call consensus earnings estimate for the year is $1.50 a share.
